intro: Zeuxine novae-hiberniae, commonly known as the Irish bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Ireland. It belongs to the genus Zeuxine within the family Iridaceae, which includes a variety of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant features upright stems with lance-shaped leaves and produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue and purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native region.
